org.araneaframework.backend.util
Class BeanUtil

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.backend.util.BeanUtil

public class BeanUtil
extends Object

This class provides methods to manipulate Bean fields. Simple (e.g. 'name') as well as nested (e.g. 'location.city') Bean fields are both supported. To propagate an empty Bean by nested fields, fillFieldValue(Object, String, Object) method is recommended instead of setFieldValue(Object, String, Object) to create missing Beans automatically.

Author:
Rein Raudj√§rv
See Also:
BeanMapper

Method Detail

getFields

public static List getFields(Class beanClass)
Returns List<String>- the List of Bean field names.

Only simple fields (not nested) are returned.

Parameters:
beanClass - the class implementing the Bean pattern.
Returns:
List<String>- the List of Bean field names.

getFieldValue

public static Object getFieldValue(Object bean,
                                   String field)
Returns the value of Bean field identified with name field for object bean.

Returns null if no bean specified or such method found.

Parameters:
bean - Object, which value to return.
field - The name of VO field.
Returns:
The value of the field.

setFieldValue

public static void setFieldValue(Object bean,
                                 String field,
                                 Object value)
Sets the value of Bean field identified by name field for object bean.

Nothing happens if no bean specified, one of its sub-field is null or no such method found.

If one of the sub-fields (not the last one) is null, they are not automatically propagated. In order for this, use fillFieldValue(Object, String, Object) method.

Parameters:
bean - bean Object, which value to set.
field - The name of Bean field.
value - The new value of the field.
See Also:
fillFieldValue(Object, String, Object)

fillFieldValue

public static void fillFieldValue(Object bean,
                                  String field,
                                  Object value)
Sets the value of Bean field identified by name field for object bean.

Nothing happens if no bean specified or such method found.

This method is identical to setFieldValue(Object, String, Object) except that mssing beans in sub-fields (not the last one) of bean Object are created automatically.

Parameters:
bean - bean Object, which value to set.
field - The name of Bean field.
value - The new value of the field.
See Also:
setFieldValue(Object, String, Object)

getFieldType

public static Class getFieldType(Class beanClass,
                                 String field)
Returns type of Bean field identified by name field.

Null is returned if no such method found.

Parameters:
beanClass - the class implementing the Bean pattern.
field - The name of Bean field.
Returns:
The type of the field.

isReadable

public static boolean isReadable(Class beanClass,
                                 String field)
Checks that the field identified by field is a valid Bean field (can be read-only).

To enable reading the field, the spcfified beanClass must have getter (field's name starts with get or is) for this field.

Parameters:
beanClass - the class implementing the Bean pattern.
field - Bean field name.
Returns:
if this field is in Bean.

isWritable

public static boolean isWritable(Class beanClass,
                                 String field)
Checks that the field identified by field is a writable Bean field.

To enable writing the field, the spcfified beanClass must have setter (field's name starts with set) for this field.

Parameters:
beanClass - the class implementing the Bean pattern.
field - Bean field name.
Returns:
whether this Bean field is writable.

isWritable

public static boolean isWritable(Class beanClass,
                                 String field,
                                 Class paramType)
Checks that the field identified by field is a writable Bean field. This method allows to specify the expected type of the input parameter of the setter.

Parameters:
beanClass - the class implementing the Bean pattern.
field - Bean field name.
paramType - The expected type of the setter method. May be null to indicate that the type must be the same as the return value of the getter method of this bean property.
Returns:
whether this Bean field is writable.
Since:
1.2

Null is returned if no such method found.

field - Bean field name.
Returns:
write method (setter) for the field.

getWriteMethod

public static Method getWriteMethod(Class beanClass,
                                    String field,
                                    Class paramType)
Returns write method (setter) for the field.

Null is returned if no such method found.

Parameters:
beanClass - the class implementing the Bean pattern.
field - Bean field name.
paramType - The (optional) parameter type of this setter. May be null to indicate that the type must be identified as the return value of the setter of this property.
Returns:
write method (setter) for the field.
Since:
1.2

newInstance

public static Object newInstance(Class beanClass)
Creates new instance of the specified beanClass.

In order to be Bean type, it must have a constructor without arguments.

If creating the new instance fails, a RuntimeException is thrown.

Parameters:
beanClass - the class implementing the Bean pattern.
Returns:
new instance of the Bean type.

copy

public static Object copy(Object from,
                          Object to)
Sets all the fields with same names to same values.

NB! the values are references (there'is no deep copy made)!

from Bean fields that are not supported by to are ignored.

Parameters:
from - Bean from which to convert.
to - Bean to which to convert.
Returns:
to with values
See Also:
copy(Object, Class)

copy

public static Object copy(Object from,
                          Class toType)
Creates a new instance of Class toType and sets its field values to be the same as given from Object. Only fields with same names that exist in both from object and toType class are affected.

Parameters:
from - Bean from which to read field values.
toType - Class which object instance to create.
Returns:
new instance of toType with from values
See Also:
copy(Object, Object), Object.clone()

clone

public static Object clone(Object bean)
Clones bean by copying its fields values (references) to a new instance of the same type.

Parameters:
bean - bean Object, which value to set.
Returns:
new instance of bean type with same fields values (references)
See Also:
copy(Object, Object), copy(Object, Class)

isBean

public static boolean isBean(Class clazz)
Returns whether the given object type is a Bean type.

Parameters:
clazz - the class.
Returns:
whether the given object type is a Bean type.
